instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image
threads.message:
turns on boots into OS but no image on screen.

j8300

pin 1= 0v
pin 2= 0v
pin 3= 4.5v
pin 4= 1.5v
pin 5= 1.4v
pin 6=1.8v
pin 7= 2.5v
pin 8= 2.5v
pin 9= 1.8v
pin 10= 2.8v
pin 11= 0v
pin 12= 1.5v
pin 28= 5v
pin 29= 5v
pin 30= 5v

I can see the screen turn on but its in a blank state with no backlight.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image
threads.message:
You miss backlight too, not only image...

"pin 9= 1.8v"
eDP LCD sets normally 2.5V there.
However, check if <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> has 3V.
If not the screen is not recognized.

"pin 28= 5v
pin 29= 5v
pin 30= 5v"
If <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> is always present, LCD should be recognized.

Some other values make me worry about LCD assemble; try known good one.
